cam_motion.complex_motion_description: The camera tail-tracks a person kayaking through a canyon, moving forward while panning to adjust to the winding path. Midway, it moves down as the kayaker enters a narrower passage.
The camera moves forward to tail-track the kayaker as they navigate the narrow canyon passage, alternately rolling counterclockwise and clockwise in sync with their paddling motion.

The camera, mounted on the wingsuit flyer's helmet, lead-tracks them, initially moving backward as they launch off the cliff. As they descend, it smoothly moves downward and backward, keeping pace with their flight.
The camera initially cranes up to reveal a group positioned around a car from a high-angle perspective. It then smoothly cranes down, ending at a level angle.
There isn't enough background information to analyze the camera movement. It is hard to determine whether the camera is moving forward, moving down, or zooming in.
